means: 仓促（做某事）( hurry的过去式过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: I mouthed a goodbye and hurried in behind Momma.
sentence.Network_cn: 我用口型默示告别，然后匆匆跟在妈妈身后走了进去。

sentence.Network_en: The girls hurried outside, climbed into the car, and drove off.
sentence.Network_cn: 姑娘们匆忙跑了出来，爬进汽车，然后开车走了。

sentence.Network_en: She hurried to the kitchen in back of the store.
sentence.Network_cn: 她赶紧进到商店后面的厨房。

高中英语单词表 ... hurriedly ad. 仓促地，忙乱地 hurried a. 仓促的，慌忙的 humorous a. 富于幽默感的，幽默的；滑稽的.
She glanced at the sleeping child and then hurried away ., 她瞟了一眼睡着的孩子 , 随即匆匆离开了.

entry.def: A hurried action is done quickly, because you do not have much time to do it in.

entry.tran: （行动）仓促的，突然的，急于应对的
entry.def: A hurried action is done suddenly, in reaction to something that has just happened.

example.ex: Downing Street denied there had been a hurried overnight redrafting of the text.
example.tran: 唐宁街否认连夜赶工改拟了文本。

entry.def: Someone who is hurried does things more quickly than they should because they do not have much time to do them.

example.ex: Parisians on the street often looked worried, hurried and unfriendly.
example.tran: 巴黎街上的路人往往看上去忧心忡忡、匆匆忙忙而且不太友善。

means.word_mean: 1. moving rapidly or performed quickly or in great haste;

auth_sentence.content: He began wading ashore in hurried, splashing strides.
auth_sentence.res_content: He began wading ashore in hurried, splashing strides.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He began wading ashore in hurried, splashing strides.

auth_sentence.content: Hill hurried downstairs, and then the phone rang.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hill hurried downstairs, and then the phone rang.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hill hurried downstairs, and then the phone rang.

auth_sentence.content: My master was seized and hurried away to a prison.
auth_sentence.res_content: My master was seized and hurried away to a prison.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My master was seized and hurried away to a prison.

Sentence.sentence: He drove in, parked and hurried home to go to bed.

sentences.en: I can’t enjoy a hurried breakfast;I like to take my time over it.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢匆匆地用早餐, 我愿意从容不迫。
